text: (bright subtle music)

- [Narrator] Welcome to the
future of manufacturing,

where data and artificial
intelligence are transforming

the way companies
optimize their operations,

reinvent their supply chains,
improve product quality,
and drive sustainable innovation.
Consider an electric bicycle manufacturer

facing common challenges,
like product quality issues,
parts and material shortages,

inefficient processes,
and workforce retention.

These hurdles jeopardize
their ability to meet demand,
and maintain quality standards.
At the root of these challenges

lie the complexities of
driving unified visibility
across manufacturing operations.

Manually integrating diverse
data sources proves tedious,
preventing them from identifying

and addressing bottlenecks
and inefficiencies.

To overcome these
challenges, they turn to AWS

for our depth and breadth of
purpose-built capabilities,
extensive partner network,

performant and scalable
edge-to-cloud infrastructure,

and the highest standards for
privacy and data security.

With AWS, the manufacturer
gains unprecedented visibility
into demand patterns and inventory levels,

leading to more accurate
forecasts, optimal supply,
and fewer operational disruptions.

Inventory managers ask a
generative AI assistant

for recommendations on how
to rebalance their stock.

This allows them to
dive deep into metrics,

and gain insights that
help them make faster,
more informed decisions.
On the factory floor,

they break down IT and
operational technology data silos.

By connecting their industrial
equipment to the cloud

and leveraging integrations
with automation partners,

they visualize and analyze near
real-time operational data,

optimizing processes
and reducing downtime.

Operators gain a holistic
view of equipment performance,
enabling proactive asset maintenance.

When issues arise, they use
a generative AI assistant
to identify root causes, troubleshoot,
and swiftly restore production.

A digital twin offers an
immersive 3D visualization
that replicates the factory floor,

integrating live telemetry
data to provide context.
This bridge between the data
and the physical reality drives faster
and more informed process optimization.

To ensure only the
highest quality products
leave the factory,

the manufacturer automates
quality inspection,
with computer vision at the edge,
detecting defects in real-time.
They enhance their dataset

with synthetic images
created using generative AI,

security transferring
these to the AWS Cloud
to continuously improve and retrain
their machine learning models.
By combining machine sensor data

with generative AI powered
maintenance analysis,
they detect equipment anomalies early,
predict spare parts needs,
and optimize maintenance schedules,

keeping production lines
running at peak efficiency.

Plant leadership uses generative
AI capabilities from AWS

to quickly generate reports
and data visualizations,
summarize insights and answer questions
to drive continuous improvement
and strategic decision-making.
With AWS and AWS Partner Solutions,

manufacturers achieve
operational excellence,
and drive transformation with the cloud,

unlocking the value of
their operational data,

and leveraging machine
learning and generative AI,
to deliver high-quality products,
and exceed customer expectations.
(bright subtle music)
